str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.
A part, portion, share. From an obsolete but more primary form of meiromai; a division or share.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Property, wealth, substance. From the feminine of on; substance, i.e. Property.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To divide into parts, cut asunder, distribute. From dia and haireomai; to separate, i.e. Distribute.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary word; life, i.e. the present state of existence; by implication, the means of livelihood.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
